newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Swiss bond market closing report.
newsitem.headline: Swiss bond market closing report.

text.p: Swiss bonds ended higher as the Swiss National Bank offered liquidity below market rates late in the day following news the Bundesbank and several other European central banks were lowering their money market rates.

The Bundesbank said it will cut its repurchase rate by 30 basis points to 3.00 percent. Shortly after the Bundesbank's announcement the SNB said it was leaving its discount rate unchanged at 1.50 percent but said it was adding "a significant quantity" of liquidity to the money market. Traders said it added funds from Friday to Monday at 2.00 percent, compared with 2-3/8 percent for overnight money earlier on Thursday.
